Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nGeorge: \nSarah: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Enrique\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George\n- Day 3, Night 3\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

#titles h1 {
	color: #000000;
}
#titles h2 {
	color: #000000;
}

/* special event: FTP success page titles */
#titles ftpsuccess {
	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

/* Page displayed body content area */
#content {
	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

/* General text */
p {
}

/* error brief description */
#error p {
}

/* some data which may have caused the problem */
#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

Talia: 
Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nGeorge: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Enrique\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Philip, Peter, George\n- Day 3, Night 3\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are George (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nGeorge: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Enrique\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter\n- Day 3, Night 3\n\nYour private info hint: Fortune Teller: NO for [Philip, Emma].\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Emma. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

/* error brief description */

/* some data which may have caused the problem */

/* the error message received from the system or other software */

    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}

    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

hr {
	margin: 0;

	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Peter. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek. The town is voting whether to execute Emma today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;

/* the error message received from the system or other software */

}

}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */

    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

	color: #000000;

	color: #000000;

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;

    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}

    border-bottom: groove;

    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;

	margin: 0;

	font-size: 9px;

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Peter. The town is voting whether to execute Emma today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah, the MONK (Good). Choose ONE player to protect tonight.\nIf the Imp targets the protected player, they do not die.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nKickoff: Last night death=Emma. State who you'd execute today and why.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Emma\n- Alive (others): Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George\n- Day 4, Night 4\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). 	padding: 10px;
	padding-left: 100px;
	background: url('/squid-internal-static/icons/SN.png') no-repeat left;
}

/* initial title */
#titles h1 {
	color: #000000;
}
#titles h2 {
	color: #000000;
}

/* special event: FTP success page titles */
#titles ftpsuccess {
	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

/* Page displayed body content area */
#content {
	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

/* General text */
p {
}

/* error brief description */
#error p {
}

/* some data which may have caused the problem */
#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

Anika: 
Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Philip (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: \nDerek: \nTalia: \nAnika: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Emma\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Peter, George\n- Day 4, Night 4\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

<p>The remote host or network may be down. Please try the request again.</p>

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: \nDerek: \nTalia: \nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nGeorge: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Emma\n- Alive (others): Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George\n- Day 4, Night 4\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nTalia: \nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nGeorge: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nTalia: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Emma\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Talia, Philip, Peter, George\n- Day 4, Night 4\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

	padding: 10px;
	padding-left: 100px;

}

	color: #000000;
}

	color: #000000;

/* special event: FTP success page titles */

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

(Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are George (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nPeter: \nGeorge: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nTalia: \nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Emma\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter\n- Day 4, Night 4\n\nYour private info hint: Fortune Teller: YES for [Philip, Derek].\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

    margin-left: 2%;

</blockquote>

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). 	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are George. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;

}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */

}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */

    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

hr {
	margin: 0;
}

	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;

</blockquote>

<p id="sysmsg">The system returned: <i>(111) Connection refused</i></p>

<p>The remote host or network may be down. Please try the request again.</p>

}

	color: #000000;
}

	color: #000000;

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

hr {
	margin: 0;
}

#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika. The town is voting whether to execute Derek today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are George. The town is voting whether to execute Derek today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter, George\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

	font-family: verdana, sans-serif;
}

html body {
	margin: 0;
	padding: 0;
	background: #efefef;
	font-size: 12px;
	color: #1e1e1e;
}

/* Page displayed title area */
#titles {
	margin-left: 15px;
	padding: 10px;
	padding-left: 100px;
	background: url('/squid-internal-static/icons/SN.png') no-repeat left;
}

/* initial title */
#titles h1 {
	color: #000000;
}
#titles h2 {
	color: #000000;
}

/* special event: FTP success page titles */
#titles ftpsuccess {
	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

/* Page displayed body content area */
#content {
	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

/* General text */
p {
}

/* error brief description */
#error p {
}

/* some data which may have caused the problem */
#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}


body
:lang(fa) { direction: rtl; font-size: 100%; font-family: Tahoma, Roya, sans-serif; float: right; }
:lang(he) { direction: rtl; }
 --></style>

<h1>ERROR</h1>
<h2>The requested URL could not be retrieved</h2>
</div>
<hr>

<div id="content">
<p>The following error was encountered while trying to retrieve the URL: <a href="http://localhost:11434/api/chat">http://localhost:11434/api/chat</a></p>

<blockquote id="error">
<p><b>Connection to 127.0.0.1 failed.</b></p>
</blockquote>

<p id="sysmsg">The system returned: <i>(111) Connection refused</i></p>

<p>The remote host or network may be down. Please try the request again.</p>

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nKickoff: Last night death=George. State who you'd execute today and why.\n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter\n- Day 5, Night 5\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

<div id="content">
<p>The following error was encountered while trying to retrieve the URL: <a href="http://localhost:11434/api/chat">http://localhost:11434/api/chat</a></p>

<blockquote id="error">
<p><b>Connection to 127.0.0.1 failed.</b></p>
</blockquote>

<p id="sysmsg">The system returned: <i>(111) Connection refused</i></p>

<p>The remote host or network may be down. Please try the request again.</p>

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: \nDerek: \nTalia: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Talia, Philip, Peter\n- Day 5, Night 5\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: \nDerek: \nTalia: \nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter\n- Day 5, Night 5\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

	margin-left: 15px;
	padding: 10px;
	padding-left: 100px;

}

/* initial title */

	color: #000000;
}

	color: #000000;
}

/* special event: FTP success page titles */

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

}

#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

(Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Anika (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nDerek: \nTalia: \nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nTalia: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Talia, Philip, Peter\n- Day 5, Night 5\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

/* the error message received from the system or other software */

}

    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}

    border-bottom: groove;
}

    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;

}

	margin: 0;

	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Philip (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nTalia: \nAnika: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nTalia: \nAnika: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Peter\n- Day 5, Night 5\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

}

#error p {
}

/* some data which may have caused the problem */
#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

:lang(fa) { direction: rtl; font-size: 100%; font-family: Tahoma, Roya, sans-serif; float: right; }
:lang(he) { direction: rtl; }
 --></style>

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Philip. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Talia, Anika, Philip, Peter (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

	padding: 10px;
	padding-left: 100px;
	background: url('/squid-internal-static/icons/SN.png') no-repeat left;
}

/* initial title */
#titles h1 {
	color: #000000;
}
#titles h2 {
	color: #000000;
}

/* special event: FTP success page titles */
#titles ftpsuccess {
	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

/* Page displayed body content area */
#content {
	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

/* General text */
p {
}

/* error brief description */
#error p {
}

/* some data which may have caused the problem */
#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}
