/*
 Stylesheet for Squid Error pages
 Adapted from design by Free CSS Templates
 http://www.freecsstemplates.org
 Released for free under a Creative Commons Attribution 2.5 License
*/

/* Page basics */
* {
	font-family: verdana, sans-serif;
}

html body {
	margin: 0;
	padding: 0;
	background: #efefef;
	font-size: 12px;
	color: #1e1e1e;
}

/* Page displayed title area */
#titles {
	margin-left: 15px;
	padding: 10px;
	padding-left: 100px;
	background: url('/squid-internal-static/icons/SN.png') no-repeat left;
}

/* initial title */
#titles h1 {
	color: #000000;
}
#titles h2 {
	color: #000000;
}

/* special event: FTP success page titles */
#titles ftpsuccess {
	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

/* Page displayed body content area */
#content {
	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

/* General text */
p {
}

/* error brief description */
#error p {
}

/* some data which may have caused the problem */
#data {
}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}


body
:lang(fa) { direction: rtl; font-size: 100%; font-family: Tahoma, Roya, sans-serif; float: right; }
:lang(he) { direction: rtl; }
 --></style>
</head><body id=ERR_CONNECT_FAIL>
<div id="titles">
<h1>ERROR</h1>
<h2>The requested URL could not be retrieved</h2>
</div>
<hr>

<div id="content">
<p>The following error was encountered while trying to retrieve the URL: <a href="http://localhost:11434/api/chat">http://localhost:11434/api/chat</a></p>

<blockquote id="error">
<p><b>Connection to 127.0.0.1 failed.</b></p>
</blockquote>

<p id="sysmsg">The system returned: <i>(111) Connection refused</i></p>

<p>The remote host or network may be down. Please try the request again.</p>

<p>Your cache administrator is <a href="mailto:webmaster?subject=CacheErrorInfo%20-%20ERR_CONNECT_FAIL&amp;body=CacheHost%3A%20ytlab01%0D%0AErrPage%3A%20ERR_CONNECT_FAIL%0D%0AErr%3A%20(111)%20Connection%20refused%0D%0ATimeStamp%3A%20Fri,%2005%20Sep%202025%2001%3A08%3A45%20GMT%0D%0A%0D%0AClientIP%3A%20128.97.88.6%0D%0AServerIP%3A%20localhost%0D%0A%0D%0AHTTP%20Request%3A%0D%0APOST%20%2Fapi%2Fchat%20HTTP%2F1.1%0AAccept-Encoding%3A%20gzip,%20deflate%0D%0AConnection%3A%20keep-alive%0D%0AContent-Type%3A%20application%2Fjson%0D%0AAccept%3A%20application%2Fjson%0D%0AUser-Agent%3A%20ollama-python%2F0.2.1%20(x86_64%20linux)%20Python%2F3.10.12%0D%0AContent-Length%3A%203334%0D%0AHost%3A%20localhost%3A11434%0D%0A%0D%0A%0D%0A">webmaster</a>.</p>

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nTalia: \nNick: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nGeorge: \nEnrique: \nMaria: \nSarah: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Anika\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 1, Night 1\n\nYour private info hint: Fortune Teller: NO for [Nick, Philip].\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

:lang(fa) { direction: rtl; font-size: 100%; font-family: Tahoma, Roya, sans-serif; float: right; }
:lang(he) { direction: rtl; }
 --></style>

Talia: 
Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nPeter: \nGeorge: \nEnrique: \nMaria: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Anika\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Philip, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 1, Night 1\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are George (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nMaria: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \nNick: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Anika\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 1, Night 1\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Talia. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

</blockquote>

<p id="sysmsg">The system returned: <i>(111) Connection refused</i></p>

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). }

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek. The town is voting whether to execute Nick today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

(One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick. The town is voting whether to execute Nick today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, George, Enrique, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}

    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}

    border-bottom: groove;

</blockquote>

<p id="sysmsg">The system returned: <i>(111) Connection refused</i></p>

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle.     border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Philip, the BUTLER (Outsider).\nChoose ONE alive player (not yourself) to be your MASTER for today’s vote.\nYou may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Peter, Enrique, Maria\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Emma (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: \nDerek: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 2, Night 2\n\nYour private info hint: Empath: You sense 0 evil among your neighbors.\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

	padding: 10px;
	padding-left: 100px;

}

	color: #000000;
}

	color: #000000;
}

/* special event: FTP success page titles */

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

/* page displayed footer area */
#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;
}

Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Philip (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: \nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \nNick: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 2, Night 2\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Sarah (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \nNick: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nEnrique: \nMaria: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 2, Night 2\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

	color: #000000;

	color: #000000;

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

}

/* the error message received from the system or other software */
#sysmsg {
}

pre {
}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

/* horizontal lines */
hr {
	margin: 0;
}

	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;

(Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Talia (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nNick: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \nEnrique: \nMaria: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nEmma: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Emma, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 2, Night 2\n\nYour private info hint: Chef: You learned 0 pair(s) of evil neighbors.\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

/* the error message received from the system or other software */

}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */

    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}

    border-bottom: groove;
}

    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

	margin: 0;

	padding-left: 10px;

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nPhilip: \nPeter: \nEnrique: \nMaria: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 2, Night 2\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

/* initial title */
#titles h1 {
	color: #000000;
}

	color: #000000;
}

	background-color:#00ff00;
	width:100%;
}

	padding: 10px;
	background: #ffffff;
}

}

/* special event: FTP / Gopher directory listing */
#dirmsg {
    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}
#dirlisting {
    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}
#dirlisting tr.entry td.icon,td.filename,td.size,td.date {
    border-bottom: groove;
}
#dirlisting td.size {
    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;
    padding-right: 5px;
}

hr {
	margin: 0;
}

#footer {
	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Enrique (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nMaria: \nSarah: \nDerek: \nEmma: \nTalia: \nNick: \nPhilip: \nPeter: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: George\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, Maria\n- Day 2, Night 2\n\nYour private info hint: (none)\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Nick. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Enrique. Choose ONE player to nominate for execution today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria (you may nominate yourself or anyone alive)\n\nReply with ONLY the exact name."}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Emma. The town is voting whether to execute Maria today.\nAlive players: Sarah, Derek, Emma, Talia, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY YES or NO."}]

    font-family: courier, monospace;
    color: black;
    font-size: 10pt;
}

    margin-left: 2%;
    margin-right: 2%;
}

    border-bottom: groove;
}

    width: 50px;
    text-align: right;

}

	margin: 0;

	font-size: 9px;
	padding-left: 10px;

Ollama Request: [{'role': 'user', 'content': "You are playing BLOOD ON THE CLOCKTOWER (Trouble Brewing – Lite). Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. <p id="sysmsg">The system returned: <i>(111) Connection refused</i></p>

<p>The remote host or network may be down. Please try the request again.</p>

Keep your secret role hidden.\n\nTEAMS & ROLES\n- GOOD (Townsfolk): Empath, FortuneTeller, Undertaker, Monk, Ravenkeeper, Chef, Slayer, Mayor\n- GOOD (Outsider): Butler\n- EVIL: Imp (Demon), Poisoner (Minion)\n\nWIN CONDITIONS\n- GOOD wins if the Imp is dead.\n- EVIL wins if the Imp is alive and only 2 players remain alive.\n\nROUND STRUCTURE\nNight (order):\n0) Chef (Good) — Night 1 only: Learn how many adjacent pairs of EVIL neighbors exist around the circle. (If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night\'s demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player\'s exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday\'s executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek, the FORTUNE TELLER (Good). Choose TWO players to check tonight.\nReply YES if either is the Imp, else NO (but note that you might be misled if poisoned).\nAlive players: Sarah, Emma, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n\nReply with ONLY the two names separated by a comma, e.g., "Alice, Bob".'}]

(If poisoned, the info may be unreliable.)\n1) Poisoner (Evil) poisons 1 player (poisoned players get false or unreliable ability results).\n2) Monk (Good) protects 1 player (that player cannot die from the night's demon kill).\n3) Imp (Evil) kills 1 player (cannot choose a dead player).\n4) Ravenkeeper (Good): If killed at night, they immediately learn 1 player's exact role.\n5) Undertaker (Good) learns the exact role of yesterday's executed player (if any).\n6) Empath (Good) learns how many of their 2 neighbors are Evil (0/1/2).\n7) FortuneTeller (Good) chooses 2 players; reply YES if either is the Imp, otherwise NO. (One player might be a “red herring”; treat logic as possibly misleading if poisoned.)\n\nDay:\n- Butler (Outsider): At the start of the day, secretly choose a MASTER (an alive player, not yourself). You may only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES.\n- Slayer (Townsfolk): Once per game during the day, you may SLAY one player instantly (that player dies immediately).\n- Table talk (open discussion).\n- Nominations & Execution: One candidate is nominated, everyone votes YES/NO. If YES votes > floor(living/2), the nominee is executed and dies.\n- Mayor (Townsfolk): If you would be executed, you may instead cancel the execution so that no one dies today.\n\nROLE DESCRIPTIONS (new in this build)\n- Chef (Good): On Night 1 only, learns the number of adjacent EVIL pairs seated next to each other around the circle. (Poisoning may corrupt this info.)\n- Slayer (Good): Once per game during the day, may declare a SLAY on a target to kill them immediately.\n- Mayor (Good): If the town votes to execute you, you may choose to prevent the execution; no one dies that day.\n- Butler (Outsider): Each day choose a MASTER. You can only vote YES if your MASTER votes YES; otherwise your vote must be NO.\n\nGENERAL\n- Players can say anything (truth or lies). Never reveal your exact role unless a prompt tells you to do so privately.\n- Output ONLY what each prompt asks for (often just a name or YES/NO).\n\nYou are Derek (keep your role secret).\nRecent discussion (latest last):\nSarah: \n\nGame state:\n- Last night death: Talia\n- Alive (others): Sarah, Emma, Nick, Philip, Peter, Enrique, Maria\n- Day 3, Night 3\n\nYour private info hint: Fortune Teller: YES for [Philip, Peter].\n\nSpeak as a real player (1–2 sentences):\n- React to 1–2 points from recent discussion by @name.\n- Say whether you'd execute the current top suspect (name someone) and why.\n- Do not reveal your exact role.\n\nReply with ONLY your message text (no prefixes)."}]
